p: Cats with CKD often exhibit a reduced appetite, and their daily caloric intake may vary widely from day to day. 20 Weight loss is a common clinical finding in cats with CKD, and is often accompanied by loss of LBM and decreased BCS in more advanced stages of the disease 20. 5 . 520 Most of the cats enrolled in this study were in early stages of CKD ( table 2), such that finding a significant loss of LBM during the 6-month feeding study was unexpected. Therefore, it was surprising that cats fed control food on average lost 11.1 per cent of LBM, whereas cats consuming test food had no loss of LBM.
